page.title: 01Landscape and Buildings.
page.content: Middleham. Historical town situated between the River Ure,(Wensleydale) and the River Cover, (Coverdale). Castle built 1190 by Ralf Fitz Ranulf- came to be owned by the Neville family. Richard 111 lived here ; his son, Edward Prince of Wales born in the Round Tower. Castle fell into ruin- Stone used for building houses - many Georgian. Centre for training racehorses. Population of Middleham approx 750. Racehorses approx 120. Church originated 13th Century but mainly 14th and 15th with much restoration early last century. dedicated to St Mary & St Alkelda. East Witton - very pretty. village green sandwiched between 2 rows of stone cottages.
